pt: {sc}relieve{/sc} {sc}alleviate{/sc} {sc}lighten{/sc} {sc}assuage{/sc} {sc}mitigate{/sc} {sc}allay{/sc} mean to make something less grievous. {sc}relieve{/sc} implies a lifting of enough of a burden to make it tolerable.

pt.t: took an aspirin to {it}relieve{/it} the pain

pt: {sc}alleviate{/sc} implies temporary or partial lessening of pain or distress.
{sc}lighten{/sc} implies reducing a burdensome or depressing weight.
{sc}assuage{/sc} implies softening or sweetening what is harsh or disagreeable.
{sc}mitigate{/sc} suggests a moderating or countering of the effect of something violent or painful.
{sc}allay{/sc} implies an effective calming or soothing of fears or alarms.
